alert.note: Alert for Howard; Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:19AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Sevier and northern Howard Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 519 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Opal to near Caney Creek Wilderness to 6 miles southwest of Athens. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dierks, Umpire, Athens, Lebanon, Muddy Fork, and Burg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas.
